sentences.english: It is supposed to enshrine the words that actually mean things.
sentences.chinese: 它應該是保存字詞基本意義的神龕。

sentences.english: So that was the end of the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 這就是那座神龕的結局，他自身都難保，如何守護人？

sentences.english: One night I visit a temple. In front of it there is a movable shrine on wheels.
sentences.chinese: 有一晚我到一個廟裏，在廟前有一種可以行駛的神龕。

sentences.english: He put the promise in the shrine beside the tablet of O-Tei.
sentences.chinese: 他將這句誓言放在神龕內阿真的牌位旁。

sentences.english: Before the Hindu shrine, flat on her face, Gold Teeth lay prostrate, rigid as a sack of flour, a large amorphous mass.
sentences.chinese: 金牙姑姑仰面的躺在印度教的神龕前面。

sentences.english: They are the mysterious divinities hidden behind the tabernacle.
sentences.chinese: 他們是藏在神龕後面的神祕聖人。

sentences.english: The ancient shrine to some long-forgotten deity, recessed into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 牆凹裏的某位被人遺忘之神的古代神龕。

sentences.english: "Gained merit in battle" reads the epitaph of two of the 231 eminent Shaolin monks honored with shrines in the Pagoda Forest.
sentences.chinese: 碑林中的神龕是用來紀念少林寺的231名傑出僧侶。

sentences.english: He entered and recited a sutra before the family shrine.
sentences.chinese: 他進了屋，在神龕前唸了經文。

definition: guardian lion, a lion statue traditionally placed at the entrance of Chinese imperial palaces, imperial tombs, temples etc
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
yaodong (a kind of cave dwelling in the Loess Plateau in northwest China)/CL:孔[kong3]
icon/iconic/religious image/figure (of Confucius, Buddha, Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1]
